newsitem.title: USA: FSI adopts shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: FSI adopts shareholder rights plan.

text.p: FSI International Inc on Thursday its board of directors adopted a shareholder rights plan.
Under the plan, the company declared a dividend of one right to buy a preferred share for each outstanding FSI share owned by holders of record on June 10. The rights expire on June 10, 2007.
The company, which makes automated surface conditioning equipment, said the plan was not in response to any current takeover attempt.
FSI said the plan was adopted to help shareholders realize the long-term value of their investment in the company and to help ensure they receive fair treatment in the event of a takeover attempt.
The rights will generally become exercisable after any person or group acquires 15 percent or more of the company's common stock or announces a tender or exchange offer.
Each right entitles shareholders to buy one-hundredth of a share of a newly created preferred stock at a price of $90, subject to adjustment.

At the option of the board, the company said it may redeem the rights at $0.001 each at any time before a public announcement of a 15 percent acquisition. The rights can also be redeemed for 20 days afterwards, unless there has been a change in board.
FSI manufactures capital equipment for the microelectronics industry.
